qas.question: What do indigenous communites not do in education?

context: Indigenous education refers to the inclusion of <a0_0><b3_0>indigenous knowledge, models, methods, and content<b3_0/><a0_0/> within <a1_0><b4_0>formal and non-formal<b4_0/> educational systems<a1_0/>. Often in a post-colonial context, the growing recognition and use of indigenous education methods can be a response to the erosion and loss of indigenous knowledge and language through the processes of colonialism. Furthermore, it can enable indigenous communities to "<b6_0>reclaim and revalue their languages and cultures<b6_0/>, and in so doing, <a2_0><b5_0>improve the educational success of indigenous students<b5_0/><a2_0/>."
